Package com.here.android.mpa.routing

This package provides classes, interfaces, and enumerations for route calculation and route description (directions).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CoreRouter.Listener
    Represents a listener to provide information about route calculation events.
    Route.DeserializationCallback
    Callback interface for when deserialization is done, passed to deserializeAsync.
    Route.SerializationCallback
    Callback interface for when serialization is done, passed to serializeAsync.
    Router<T,S extends java.lang.Enum<?>>
    Base interface for route calculation class.
    Router.Listener<T,S extends java.lang.Enum<?>>  
    UMRouter.Listener
    Represents a listener to provide information about route calculation events.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConsumptionParameters
    Stores information about consumption parameters of vehicle.
    ConsumptionParameters.ConsumptionForSpeed
    Specifies consumption per meter for different travel speeds.
    ConsumptionParameters.TrafficScale
    Defines the traffic speed/free-flow speed adjustment scale.
    CoreRouter
    Route calculation executor handling core routing types (Car, Truck, Pedestrian).
    DynamicPenalty
    This class represents a policy containing road, area, and traffic restriction factors that are taken into account while calculating routes.
    Maneuver
    Represents the action required to leave one street segment and enter the next in the chain of directions that comprises a calculated Route.
    Route
    Represents a distinct path connecting two or more waypoints GeoCoordinate.
    Route.DeserializationResult
    Represents the result of a Route de-serialization
    Route.SerializationResult
    Represents the result of a Route serialization
    RouteConsumption
    Route consumptions.
    RouteElement
    Represents an element within a Route.
    RouteElements
    Holds the list of RouteElement objects obtained from the Route class.
    RouteOptions
    This is the definition of the RouteOptions class.
    RoutePlan
    RoutePlan contains all information needed to calculate a Route.
    RouteResult
    This is the definition of the RouteResult class.
    RouteTta
    Describes Time To Arrival details for a given route.
    RouteWaypoint
    Represents a waypoint to be used in a route calculation.
    RouteWaypoint.RoadInfo
    Exposes additional information about RouteWaypoint, mainly the side of the road it's on.
    RoutingZone
    Class provides basic information about the routing zone and can be passed as an option to routing.
    Signpost
    This class stores signpost information along the Route.
    Signpost.LocalizedLabel
    Signpost information can be used for navigation (both audible and graphical/textual navigation) and map display.
    TransitManeuver
    Represents the transit specific action required to leave one street segment and enter the next in the chain of directions that comprises a calculated Transit Route .
    TransitRouteElement
    Represents an element within a transit-specific Route.
    TransitRouteSourceAttribution
    This class contains copyright notices that must be displayed to the end user.
    TransitRouteStop
    This is a public transit stop within a calculated transit Route.
    TransitRouteSupplier
    This class contains structured information about a source data supplier.
    TransitRouteSupplierNote
    This class contains giving additional information about the supplier.
    TruckRestriction
    Gives information about the truck restriction, e.g.

    Ways that the time can be specified.

    Defines way of handling road segments on which violated static truck restriction applies.
    RouteOptions.TruckType
    Defines names for different types of trucks.
    RouteOptions.TunnelCategory
    Specify the ADR tunnel category to restrict the truck route to.
    RouteOptions.Type
    Represents different types of routing, such as by speed or by distance.
    RouteResult.ViolatedOption
    These are options which may be ignored by the routing engine; in such cases a list of violated options is returned in the listener's on_end() method.
    RouteTta.Detail
    Additional Time To Arrival Details
    RouteWaypoint.RoadInfo.RoadSide
    Represents side of the road, used to indicate position relative to a road, according to travel direction.
    RouteWaypoint.Type
    Represents different types of waypoints.
    RouteWaypoint.WaypointDirection
    Represents different waypoint direction.
    RoutingError
    Represents values describing possible route calculation errors.
    RoutingZone.Type
    Defines possible routing zone types used for zone exclusions from route during calculation.
    TransitManeuver.TransitLineStyle
    Represents values describing different line styles.
    TransitRouteStop.Attribute
    Represents values describing different attributes for a TransitRouteStop.
    TruckRestriction.HazMat
    Represents truck hazardous material type.
    TruckRestriction.TrailerType
    Represents restriction on a link or lane related to trucks with a specified number of trailers.
    TruckRestriction.Type
    Represents truck restriction type.
    TruckRestriction.WeatherType
    Represents weather condition restriction.
    UMCalculateResult.ViolatedOption
    These are options which might not be taken into account when calculating the UMCalculateResult.
    UMRouter.SubsequentRouteType
    Defines if earlier or later routes should be requested.

Package com.here.android.mpa.routing Description

This package provides classes, interfaces, and enumerations for route calculation and route description (directions).

Note: the CoreRouter class provides access to the route calculation functionality.

To calculate a route, you need:

  • a parameter list containing at least two waypoints for the start and end of the route - this is an instance of RoutePlan
  • a set of routing options to control route calculation features - this is an instance of RouteOptions
  • an event listener for listening to CoreRouter events - this is an instance of CoreRouter.Listener

Note that to use transit and truck route calculation feature, your application must include the google-gson library (release 2.2.4 or a compatible version) on its class path. This library can be downloaded from the google-gson project website at http://code.google.com/p/google-gson/. Attempting to use to use transit and truck route calculation features without adding this library will cause runtime errors.

For more information on how to use the CoreRouter, please see the "Directions" section in the HERE SDK for Android Developer's Guide
